page.title: 2009â10 Ball State Cardinals men's basketball team

revisions.rev:
{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |Year=2009â10 |Prev year=2008â09 |Next year=2010â11 |Team=Ball State Cardinals |Image= |Conference=Mid-American Conference |Division=
West Division |ShortConference=MAC |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=15–11 |ConfRecord=8–5 |HeadCoach=[[Billy Taylor (basketball)|Billy Taylor]] |AsstCoach1=Bob Simmons |AsstCoach2=Joseph Price |AsstCoach3=Jay Newberry |StadiumArena=[[Worthen Arena]] |Champion= |BowlTourney= }} {{2009â10 Mid-American Conference men's basketball standings}} The '''2009â10 [[Ball State University]] [[Ball State Cardinals|Cardinals]] [[Ball State Cardinals men's basketball|basketball team]]''' represent Ball State University in the college basketball season of [[2009â10 NCAA Division I men's basketball season|2009â10]]. The team is coached by [[Billy Taylor]] and play their homes game in [[John E. Worthen Arena]]. ==Before the season== ===Roster Changes=== The Cardinals lost three starters from last year's squad due to graduation. Of those three seniors, Brandon Lampley was the only one with a double digit Points-per-game statistic, with 10.0 points per game. Along with him were two other guards from the team, Laron Frazier and Rob Giles. Along with these three players, Ball State also lost two other players, one of those being [[Anthony Newell]]. Newell was only five points away from breaking 1,000 points within Ball State's men's basketball team when he broke his leg in a 46â42 victory over [[Eastern Michigan Eagles men's basketball|Eastern Michigan]].{{cite news |title=MEN'S BASKETBALL: Newell to miss remainder of season with broken leg |first=Andrew |last=Walker |newspaper=The Ball State Daily News Online |date=2009-01-11 |url=http://media.www.bsudailynews.com/media/storage/paper849/news/2009/01/07/Sports/Mens-Basketball.Newell.To.Miss.Remainder.Of.Season.With.Broken.Leg-3583148.shtml}} Junior Eric Wormely also left the team when he transferred to another college for more playing time.{{cite news |title=For The Record |newspaper=Winston-Salem Journal |date= |url=http://www2.journalnow.com/content/2009/apr/26/for-the-record/c_1/}} No transfers came in to Ball State for the 2009â2010 season. All four recruits are new freshmen. ===Recruiting=== {{College Athlete Recruit Start|40=no|collapse=no}} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Huzie Hambrite | position = PG | hometown = Mattoon, Illinois | highschool = Lake Land JC | feet = 5 | inches = 10 | weight = 175 | commitdate = 2009-11-14 | scout stars = 1 | rivals stars = | espn grade = }} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Myron Green | position = SG | hometown = Carson, California | highschool = Dominguez HS | feet = 6 | inches = 4 | weight = 200 | commitdate = | scout stars = | rivals stars = | espn grade = 79 }} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Jauwan Scaife | position = SG | hometown = Muncie, Indiana | highschool = Muncie Central HS | feet = 6 | inches = 2 | weight = 185 | commitdate = 2009-05-20 | scout stars = 2 | rivals stars = | espn grade = 83 }} {{College Athlete Recruit End | year = 2009 | rivals ref title = Ball State Commit List for 2009 | scout ref title = Scout.com: Men's Basketball Recruiting | espn ref title = Ball State Basketball Recruiting 2009 | rivals school = 106 | scout s = 335 | espn schoolid = 2050 | scout overall = | rivals overall = | accessdate = 2009-10-09 | bball = yes }} ==Roster== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0;
